Sentencas: Finely dispersed (CeO2)(1-x)(Sm2O3)(x) (x = 0.05, 0.10, 0.20) and (CeO2)(1-x)(Nd2O3)(x) (x = 0.05, 0.10, 0.15, 0.20, 0.25) powders were synthesized via liquid-phase techniques based on the co-precipitation of hydroxides and were used to obtain ceramic materials comprising fluorite-like solid solutions with CSR in the range 69-88 nm (upon annealing at 1300 & DEG;C) and open porosity in the range 0.6-6.2%.
Titulo: Comparative Study of Physicochemical Properties of Finely Dispersed Powders and Ceramics in the Systems CeO2-Sm2O3 and CeO2-Nd2O3 as Electrolyte Materials for Medium Temperature Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The physicochemical properties of the synthesized materials were comparatively characterized.
Titulo: Comparative Study of Physicochemical Properties of Finely Dispersed Powders and Ceramics in the Systems CeO2-Sm2O3 and CeO2-Nd2O3 as Electrolyte Materials for Medium Temperature Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In general, the prepared materials were found to possess a mixed type of electrical conductivity, but in the medium-temperature range, the ionic component was predominant (ion transfer numbers t(i) = 0.93-0.73 at 300-700 & DEG;C).
Titulo: Comparative Study of Physicochemical Properties of Finely Dispersed Powders and Ceramics in the Systems CeO2-Sm2O3 and CeO2-Nd2O3 as Electrolyte Materials for Medium Temperature Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The highest ionic conductivity was observed for CeO2-based samples containing 20 mol.% Sm2O3 (& sigma;(700 & DEG;C) = 3.3 x 10(-2)
Titulo: Comparative Study of Physicochemical Properties of Finely Dispersed Powders and Ceramics in the Systems CeO2-Sm2O3 and CeO2-Nd2O3 as Electrolyte Materials for Medium Temperature Fuel Cells

Titulo: Comparative Study of Physicochemical Properties of Finely Dispersed Powders and Ceramics in the Systems CeO2-Sm2O3 and CeO2-Nd2O3 as Electrolyte Materials for Medium Temperature Fuel Cells

Sentencas: S/cm) was in the temperature range 500-700 & DEG;C. The physicochemical properties (density, open porosity, type and mechanism of electrical conductivity) of the obtained ceramic materials make them promising as solid oxide electrolytes for medium temperature fuel cells.
